page.title: 10Ecology : Nature Reserve
page.content: ECOLOGY:the Nature Reserve:habitats Within the nature reserve there are four main habitats: 1.SEA WATER POOL:this is fed daily with water pumped from the River Mersey.The water never freezes over even in the severest winter.Many sea birds feed on the fish drawn in through the pumping station. 2.FRESHWATER POOL:this attracts fresh water fowl asa well as providing watering places for migrants and local birds.It tends to freeze in hard frost 3.UNDULATING,TIPPED AREA SOUTH OF THE INNER POOL:Few pools amongst the rough grassed hummocks.Frogs and other amphibia are likely to inhabit here. 4.FLATTER,TIPPED AREAS:there is a lot of salt water spray affecting this area and so very little grows here.
